Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of faded lotus flower in added white above two faded white bands; exterior: narrow black band on edge of rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx (hair and curlicue, wing and trace of body remaining), to left.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the third stage of the Group of the Simple Figures. The vases in this group were probably all produced by the same hand. The leading vase from this group is the Tarentum chalice (Lemos 1991, no. 938). Flat-headed passant sphinxes with long hair falling in three separate tresses are a recurrent theme.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 131, p. 288, no. 848, pl. 118) (Incorrectly labelled as 1888.6-1.474g)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1044) (phase 2)
